about.title: Our Mission
about.paragraph1: At UNIDXS, we fight to build a more just, supportive, and inclusive society. We firmly believe that every person deserves equal opportunities to achieve their dreams and develop their full potential.
about.paragraph2: We are committed to helping people develop their life projects. We work every day to eliminate barriers that prevent progress and create spaces where everyone can thrive.
about.paragraph3: The UNIDXS WNC Team thanks each and every person who joined us at our community events like UNIDXS for Life. We are here to serve you and build a better future together.

empower.title: EMPOWER TOGETHER
empower.paragraph: Welcome to UNIDXS, where we are passionate about community improvement through our dedicated educational program and support services. Our goal is to see individuals thrive by providing them with the resources they need to overcome challenges and grow. By joining forces with us, you become part of a movement committed to making a meaningful difference in people's lives. Let's work together to create a brighter future for our community.

valeria.name: Valeria Barrera
valeria.description: Managing our financial resources with integrity and transparency.

ricardo.name: Ricardo Bello Ball
ricardo.description: As the founder of Unidxs WNC in 2021, Ricardo has since worked tirelessly to support our Latin community. Ricardo has 25 years of experience working with the Latin community.

paul.name: Paul Witty
paul.description: Paul has his BS in Occupational Therapy and has 20 years of experience working for the NC Department of Health before taking on his Community Health Worker role with Unidxs. He is also on the Southwestern Community College Advisory Committee for Occupational Therapy.

sarahWest.name: Sarah West
sarahWest.description: In 2022, Sarah graduated from Western Carolina University with a BA in Spanish and International Studies and minors in Global Business and Philosophy. She is currently working on her graduate certificate in TESOL. After graduating, she worked at Southwestern Community College as a College and Career Readiness Coordinator overseeing the English Language Acquisition and High School Equivalency programs for two years before taking on her new role with Unidxs WNC.

sarah.name: Sarah Hirsch
sarah.description: Sarah Hirsch is a longtime educator in English and Spanish. She holds Masters degrees in both languages and is certified in translation and medical interpretation.

cristela.name: Cristela Moreno
cristela.description: Cristela has a background in Mechanical Engineering.

nita.name: Nita Lipan
nita.description: Nita Lipan brings over 20 years of educational experience to rural communities in Western North Carolina. With an interdisciplinary degree in Law and Psychology with a specialization in History from the University of Central Florida, Nita approaches educational challenges with a unique and multifaceted perspective. Known as 'The Swiss Army Knife of Education' for her versatility, she has led curriculum development, managed teaching teams, and was recognized with the Employee of the Year award. At UNIDXS, Nita develops educational programs that provide resources and opportunities to students, including creating advisory councils for school partners at Smoky Mountain High School and Blue Ridge Early College, the Hispanic heritage reading club 'Unidxs: Roots and Futures,' and weekly tutoring at Jackson Community School. Certifications: Youth Mental Health First Aid, PMQ, CTC, Lean Six Sigma White Belt, Academic Counseling, K-6 Certified Educator.

esteban.name: Dr. Esteban Ramirez
esteban.description: Dr. Esteban Ramirez serves as the Development and Grants lead for Unidxs Western North Carolina. He guides fundraising and long term planning with a focus on uplifting rural immigrant communities through education, wellness and community resilience. Esteban is known for bringing clarity to complex initiatives, weaving together resources and people in ways that open new possibilities for families across the region. His work reflects a deep belief in dignity, opportunity and belonging for every person, and a commitment to building solutions that last.

intro.title: Who We Are
intro.description: UNIDXS is a local, intercultural, non-political organization committed to serving our community in the seven rural counties of Western NC, especially within the Hispanic Community. We work to promote social inclusion, equality, and solidarity through the development and implementation of educational, social and cultural projects.
intro.description2: UNIDXS is a local, intercultural, politically independent organization committed to serving the community. Our mission is to help people or groups impacted by social, economic, educational, and cultural inequities.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Our mission is to help people, especially those who find themselves in vulnerable social, economic, educational, or cultural situations, to ensure inclusion in the community and achieve a fairer, more supportive society that allows them to improve their quality of life.

vision.title: Our Vision
items: Promote greater social inclusion, educational opportunities, cultural awareness, and acceptance.
Strive to continuously improve the services we provide to our beneficiaries, regardless of color, race, sex, and ethnicity.

values.title: Our Core Values
values.description: At UNIDXS, our core values guide every action we take. We believe in the strength that comes from neighbors working together, the importance of treating everyone with dignity, and creating opportunities so that every voice can be heard. By living these values, we support individuals, strengthen our community, and build a place where all families can flourish together.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: At UNIDXS WNC, we are committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and safeguard your personal information.

collection.title: Information We Collect
collection.content: We may collect personal information such as your name, email address, phone number, and other contact details when you interact with our services, attend our events, or contact us for support.

usage.title: How We Use Your Information
usage.content: We use your information to provide our services, communicate with you about programs and events, respond to your inquiries, and improve our community support initiatives. We do not sell or share your personal information with third parties for marketing purposes.

protection.title: Data Protection
protection.content: We implement appropriate security measures to protect your personal information from unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. However, no method of transmission over the internet is 100% secure.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.content: You have the right to access, correct, or delete your personal information. You may also opt out of receiving communications from us at any time. To exercise these rights, please contact us using the information provided below.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at (828) 242-7345 or visit our office in Western North Carolina.

terms.title: Terms of Use
terms.intro: By accessing and using UNIDXS WNC services, you agree to comply with these Terms of Use. Please read them carefully.

services.title: Our Services
services.content: UNIDXS WNC provides educational programs, health support, food pantry services, and community resources to residents of Western North Carolina. Our services are provided on a voluntary basis and are subject to availability.

conduct.title: User Conduct
conduct.content: You agree to use our services respectfully and lawfully. You must not engage in any behavior that is harmful, threatening, or disruptive to our staff, volunteers, or other community members.

liability.title: Limitation of Liability
liability.content: UNIDXS WNC strives to provide accurate information and quality services. However, we make no warranties or guarantees about the completeness, reliability, or accuracy of our services. We are not liable for any damages arising from your use of our services.

modifications.title: Modifications to Terms
modifications.content: We reserve the right to modify these Terms of Use at any time. Changes will be effective immediately upon posting. Your continued use of our services constitutes acceptance of the modified terms.
